title: Meet the retired oil exec plugging forgotten wells to reduce emissions

multiple-choice.question: What is an "orphan well" in the context of oil and gas production?

options.label: A
options.text: A well that is no longer producing oil or gas.

options.label: B
options.text: A well that has been abandoned by its owner and not properly sealed.

options.label: C
options.text: A well that is still producing oil or gas but has no known owner.

options.label: D
options.text: A well that has been plugged and abandoned.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, how many orphan oil and gas wells are estimated to exist in the United States?
What is the main environmental concern associated with orphan wells?
Who is responsible for plugging orphan wells in the United States?
According to the transcript, what is the estimated cost of plugging an orphan well?
